citation.article-title: Dokdonella fugitiva sp. nov., a Gammaproteobacterium isolated from potting soil.

p.s: Description of Dokdonella fugitiva sp. nov.
D. fugitiva (fu.gi.ti’va; L.fem. adj. fugitiva, fleeing, fugitive, because the organism fled to Portugal, where it was isolated.).
D. fugitiva forms rod cells 0.4 μm in width by 1.7–5.8 μm in length.
Gram stain is negative and non-motile.
Aerobic and heterotrophic.
Colonies are circular, convex, greenish-yellow and glossy resembling the shine of glass, mainly when growing in BCYE medium.
Weakly oxidase positive, catalase positive.

The optimum temperature for growth is about 40 °C, no growth occurs at 15 or 50 °C; the optimum pH is 7.0, no growth occurs at pH 5.0 or 8.5; the growth rate is higher without added NaCl, but grows up to 2.0% NaCl.
The predominant fatty acids are iso-17:1 ω9c, iso-17:0, iso-15:0, iso-16:0 and iso-11:0 3OH.
Does not hydrolyze arginine, esculin or elastin.
Hydrolyzes casein, gelatin, starch, arbutin, tween 20, tween 40, tween 60 and tween 80.
DNAse and β-galactosidase are detected.
Xylanase and urease are not detected.
Does not reduce nitrate.
Does not form indole.

The organism assimilates d-mannose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, d-mannitol, α-Methyl-d-mannoside, α-Methyl-d-glucoside, N-Acetyl glucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, esculin, salicin, d-maltose, d-sacarose, d-trehalose, d-melezitose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, β-gentiobiose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, acetate, l-glutamate, l-alanine, l-isoleucine, l-lysine, l-proline, l-glutamine, l-serine, l-ornithine, l-leucine, pyruvate and citrate.
Acid is not produced from any of the carbohydrates tested.
The mole G+C ratio of the DNA of the type strain is 68.3 mol%.
This bacterium was isolated from a potting soil, produced in Portugal.
The type strain, A3T, has been deposited in the Collection of the Institute Pasteur, Paris, France CIP 108692T, and in the BCCM/LMG Bacteria Collection, Ghent, Belgium as strain LMG 23001T.
